RENUNCIATION OF AN INHERITANCE
(1) An heir may renounce his or her inheritance by giving a statement to the court before the end of the probate hearing.
(2) The renunciation shall also apply to the descendants of the person who has renounced his or her inheritance unless he or she has specifically stated that he or she is renouncing his or her inheritance only on his or her own behalf.
(3) If the descendants are minors, approval by the competent social services centre shall not be necessary for renouncing an inheritance.
(4) If an heir renounces his or her inheritance only on his or her own behalf, it shall be as if he or she was never an heir.
(5) If all the heirs belonging to the closest order of succession renounce their inheritance, the heirs in the next order of succession shall be called on to inherit.
